title: Congratulating John H. Adams upon the occasion of his designation as a recipient of the 2010 Presidential Medal of Freedom
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION congratulating John H. Adams upon the occasion of
his designation as a recipient of the 2010 Presidential Medal of Freedom

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body  to  recognize  that
the  quality  and  character  of life in the communities across New York
State are enhanced by the concerned and dedicated efforts  of  organiza-
tions  and  individuals that generously contribute to the welfare of the
community and its citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, John H. Adams has given not only of his time and energies but
also of his competence, intelligence and  leadership,  and  consequently
has  been  designated  for  special  recognition by the President of the
United States; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late John H. Adams upon the occasion of his designation as  a  recipient
of the 2010 Presidential Medal of Freedom; and
  WHEREAS,  On  November  17, 2010, President Barack Obama named John H.
Adams as one of the 15 recipients of the Presidential Medal of  Freedom,
the Nation's highest civilian honor; and
  WHEREAS, The Presidential Medal of Freedom is presented to individuals
who have made especially meritorious contributions to significant public
or  private  endeavors;  in  the  words  of  the President of the United
States, "the outstanding honorees come from a broad range of backgrounds
and have excelled in a broad range of fields; all  of  them  have  lived
extraordinary  lives  that  have  inspired us, enriched our culture, and
made our country and our world a better place"; and
  WHEREAS, John H. Adams co-founded the Natural Resources Defense  Coun-
cil in 1970; he served as Executive Director and, later, as President of
the nonprofit environmental advocacy group until 2006; and
  WHEREAS,  The tenure of John H. Adams at the Natural Resources Defense
Council is unparalleled by the leader of any other environmental  organ-
ization;  as ROLLING STONE wrote, "If the planet has a lawyer, it's John
Adams"; and
  WHEREAS, Prior to co-founding the Natural Resources  Defense  Council,
John  H.  Adams  worked  as  an Assistant United States Attorney for the
Southern District of New York and for the  Center  for  Law  and  Social
Policy  in  Washington,  D.C.; in 1972, he joined the adjunct faculty of
New York University's School of Law where he  taught  Clinical  Environ-
mental Law for 26 years; and
  WHEREAS,  John  H.  Adams  serves as Chairman of the Board of the Open
Space Institute; he is also on the boards of the League of  Conservation
Voters,  Center  for  American  Progress, Woods Hole Research Center and
Duke University's Nicholas School of the Environment and Earth Sciences;
and
  WHEREAS, In addition, John H. Adams has also served on the Pew  Oceans
Commission,  the  President's Council on Sustainable Development and the
Environmental Protection Agency's Common Sense Initiative; he  is  Chair
of  the  Board  of  the  Open  Space Institute and sits on the boards of
numerous other environmental organizations and  has  served  on  govern-
mental  advisory  committees,  including President Clinton's Council for
Sustainable Development; and
  WHEREAS, John H. Adams grew up on a  farm  in  Callicoon  Center,  New
York;  he is a graduate of Michigan State University (B.A.) and the Duke
University School of Law (LL.B.); and

  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  an  indi-
vidual  of  such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our atten-
tion, he should be recognized by all the citizens of this  great  Empire
State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate John H. Adams upon the occasion of  his  designation  as  a
recipient of the 2010 Presidential Medal of Freedom; and be it further
  RESOLVED,  That copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be trans-
mitted to John H. Adams, 33 Craigie Clair Road, Roscoe, New York 12776.
